title: Issue Editor - Phase 4
description:
## Summary
Implement a slide-out panel for viewing and editing issues. All mutations require explicit confirmation with a diff preview. This enables the "Can I fix that?" capability from the project vision.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Slide-out panel opens when clicking an issue
- [ ] Full issue display with all fields
- [ ] Editable fields: status, priority, title, description, labels, assignee
- [ ] Read-only fields displayed: id, created_at, created_by
- [ ] Form validation prevents invalid data
- [ ] Confirmation modal shows diff of changes
- [ ] Save executes bd update command
- [ ] Cancel discards changes and closes panel
- [ ] Dependencies tab shows blockers with add/remove
- [ ] Comments tab shows/adds comments
- [ ] History tab shows audit trail

## Context
Part of Town View roadmap - Phase 4
Integrates with bd CLI for write operations.
Follows "Confirmed Writes" principle - no accidental changes.

## Constraints
- Must use bd CLI for all mutations (no direct file writes)
- Diff must be human-readable
- Panel should not block main dashboard view

title: Slide-out panel component
description: Create SlideOutPanel component that slides from right. 400px width, full height. Backdrop overlay with click-to-close. Smooth animation. Close button in header.

title: Issue display with read-only fields
description: Display full issue in panel: id, type, status, priority, title, description, labels, assignee, created_at, created_by. Read-only fields styled differently from editable.

title: Editable form fields with validation
description: Make fields editable: status dropdown, priority dropdown, title input, description textarea, labels multi-select, assignee dropdown. Validate required fields. Show validation errors inline.

title: Confirmation modal with diff preview
description: Show confirmation modal before save. Display diff of changes: field name, old value, new value. Green for additions, red for removals. Confirm/Cancel buttons.

title: bd CLI integration for save
description: Execute bd update command on confirm. Build command from changed fields. Handle success/error responses. Show toast notification on result. Close panel on success.

title: Dependencies tab
description: Add Dependencies tab to editor panel. List blockers and blocked-by. Add dependency button opens selector. Remove dependency with confirmation. Uses bd dep commands.

title: Comments tab
description: Add Comments tab showing issue comments. Display comment author, timestamp, body. Add comment form at bottom. Uses bd comments commands for CRUD.

title: History tab
description: Add History tab showing audit trail. List all changes: timestamp, actor, field, old→new value. Scrollable list, newest first. Read-only view.

title: Roadmap View - Phase 3
description:
## Summary
Build an epic hierarchy tree visualization showing the roadmap structure. Users can navigate work items as a tree, expand/collapse nodes, and filter by various criteria. This provides the "What's coming?" view from the project vision.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Tree component renders epic → issue → task hierarchy
- [ ] Nodes expand/collapse on click
- [ ] Keyboard navigation works (arrow keys, enter to expand)
- [ ] Status icons displayed: ○ open, ◐ in_progress, ● blocked, ✓ closed
- [ ] Priority color coding applied to nodes
- [ ] Filter controls for status work
- [ ] Filter controls for type work
- [ ] Filter controls for assignee work
- [ ] Filter controls for priority range work
- [ ] Click node opens issue in editor panel
- [ ] Dependency arrows toggle (optional feature)

## Context
Part of Town View roadmap - Phase 3
Builds on Phase 2 dashboard infrastructure.
Tree visualization is central to understanding work breakdown.

## Constraints
- Must handle deeply nested hierarchies gracefully
- Performance must remain smooth with 100+ nodes
- Collapse state should persist during session

title: Tree hierarchy data structure
description: Create data model for epic→issue→task hierarchy. Build tree from flat bead list using parent relationships. Export functions: buildTree(), getChildren(), getAncestors().

title: Tree node component with expand/collapse
description: Create TreeNode component with expand/collapse toggle. Indentation by depth level. Chevron icon rotates on expand. Smooth height animation for children reveal.

title: Status and priority icons for tree nodes
description: Add status icons to tree nodes: ○ open, ◐ in_progress, ● blocked, ✓ closed. Apply priority color coding to node text/border. Icons should be consistent with design system.

title: Keyboard navigation for tree
description: Implement keyboard nav: ↑↓ to move focus, ←→ to collapse/expand, Enter to select/open. Focus indicator visible. Tab order respects tree structure.

title: Filter controls for tree view
description: Add filter bar: status dropdown, type dropdown, assignee dropdown, priority range slider. Filters hide non-matching nodes but keep ancestors visible. Clear all button.

title: Dependency arrows visualization
description: Optional toggle to show dependency arrows between nodes. Draw SVG arrows for blocks/blocked-by relationships. Arrows should curve gracefully and not overlap excessively.

title: Dashboard View - Phase 2
description:
## Summary
Enhance the rig dashboard with agent cards, improved filtering, and real-time updates. This phase transforms the basic issue list into a full monitoring dashboard showing agent status, work progress, and live updates.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Agent cards component renders for each agent type (witness, refinery, crew, polecats)
- [ ] Agent state displayed (idle/working/stuck) with visual indicators
- [ ] Hooked bead shown on each agent card
- [ ] Issue list shows status badges with color coding
- [ ] Issue list shows priority badges (P0 red → P4 gray)
- [ ] Filter controls work for status dropdown
- [ ] Filter controls work for issue_type dropdown
- [ ] Live updates reflected in UI without page refresh
- [ ] Visual feedback (flash/highlight) when data updates via WebSocket

## Context
Part of Town View roadmap - Phase 2
Builds on Phase 1 (Tracer Bullet) which established basic data flow.
Design tokens and components from DESIGN_SYSTEM.md apply.

## Constraints
- Must use existing WebSocket infrastructure
- Follow design system color tokens for status/priority
- Agent data comes from bd list with agent type filter

title: Agent cards component with status indicators
description: Create AgentCard component displaying agent type (witness, refinery, crew, polecat), state (idle/working/stuck) with visual indicators, and currently hooked bead. Uses design system tokens for status colors.

title: Issue list status badges
description: Add status badges to issue list items. Use design system color tokens: open=blue, in_progress=yellow, blocked=red, closed=green. Badge should be pill-shaped with status icon.

title: Issue list priority badges
description: Add priority badges to issue list. Color coding: P0=red, P1=orange, P2=yellow, P3=blue, P4=gray. Badge displays Pn label with appropriate background.

title: Filter controls for status and type
description: Add dropdown filter controls above issue list. Status dropdown: all/open/in_progress/blocked/closed. Type dropdown: all/bug/feature/task/epic/chore. Filters update list in real-time.

title: WebSocket real-time update integration
description: Connect dashboard to WebSocket for live updates. Subscribe to bead change events. Update local state when beads change. Handle connection/reconnection gracefully.

title: Visual feedback for data updates
description: Add flash/highlight animation when data updates via WebSocket. Brief background color pulse on changed rows. Subtle but noticeable feedback that something updated.

title: Polish - Phase 6
description:
## Summary
Final polish phase adding keyboard navigation, dark mode, performance optimization, and error resilience. This phase ensures the application is production-ready and pleasant to use.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Full keyboard navigation throughout app
- [ ] Keyboard shortcuts documented and discoverable
- [ ] Dark mode toggle works
- [ ] Dark mode colors follow design system
- [ ] Performance profiled and optimized
- [ ] Virtual scrolling for large lists
- [ ] Graceful error handling (no white screens)
- [ ] Offline resilience - shows cached data when backend unavailable
- [ ] Loading states for all async operations
- [ ] Error boundaries catch component failures

## Context
Part of Town View roadmap - Phase 6 (Final)
Builds on all previous phases.
Focus is UX refinement, not new features.

## Constraints
- No new features - only polish existing
- Must maintain bundle size reasonable
- Accessibility standards should be met

title: Keyboard navigation system
description: Global keyboard shortcuts: / for search, g+d dashboard, g+r roadmap, g+a audit, Esc close panels. Focus management. Shortcut hints in UI. Help modal with all shortcuts.

title: Dark mode toggle and theming
description: Add dark mode toggle in header. Implement CSS custom properties for theme colors. Persist preference in localStorage. System preference detection as default.

title: Performance optimization with virtual scrolling
description: Implement virtual scrolling for long lists (100+ items). Only render visible items. Smooth scroll behavior. Maintain scroll position on data updates.

title: Error handling and boundaries
description: Add React error boundaries around major sections. Graceful fallback UI on component crash. Log errors for debugging. Recovery actions where possible.

title: Offline resilience
description: Cache last known data in localStorage/IndexedDB. Show cached data when backend unavailable. Clear indicator of offline state. Auto-reconnect and refresh when online.

title: Loading states for async operations
description: Add loading spinners/skeletons for all async operations. Skeleton screens for initial load. Inline spinners for updates. Disable buttons during submit.

title: Audit View - Phase 5
description:
## Summary
Build the audit view for reviewing polecat work vs assignments. This answers "What happened?" by showing convoy history, agent timelines, and work comparison.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Convoy selector dropdown lists available convoys
- [ ] Date range picker for filtering audit period
- [ ] Assignment vs completion side-by-side comparison
- [ ] Original bead state shown (what was dispatched)
- [ ] Final bead state shown (what was delivered + close reason)
- [ ] Agent timeline shows who touched what, when
- [ ] Diff view shows description changes over time
- [ ] Metrics displayed: time to complete, re-assignments, conflicts
- [ ] Export audit report (optional)

## Context
Part of Town View roadmap - Phase 5
Critical for oversight of autonomous agent work.
Convoy data comes from convoy-type beads.

## Constraints
- Must handle convoys with many issues
- Timeline should be zoomable/scrollable
- Historical data may be large - consider pagination

title: Convoy selector component
description: Dropdown to select convoy for audit. List convoys by date/name. Show convoy status (active/completed). On select, load convoy data for audit view.

title: Date range picker
description: Add date range picker for filtering audit period. Start date and end date inputs. Preset buttons: today, this week, this month. Filter events within range.

title: Assignment vs completion comparison
description: Side-by-side view: left shows original assignment (bead when dispatched), right shows final state (bead when closed). Highlight differences in status, description, labels.

title: Agent timeline component
description: Horizontal timeline showing agent activity. Each agent as a swim lane. Events plotted by timestamp. Hover shows event details. Zoom/scroll for navigation.

title: Diff view for bead changes
description: Show description changes over time as unified diff. Split view: before/after. Syntax highlighting for markdown. Navigate between change versions.

title: Metrics display
description: Dashboard cards showing: time to complete (avg, min, max), re-assignments count, merge conflicts count. Calculated from audit events. Visual indicators for anomalies.
